intro: Chamaecrista glandulosa var. ramosa, commonly known as the slender crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
